intro: Micromeria macrosiphon, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has a low, sprawling growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its adaptability to harsh conditions, it is considered a resilient species in its native range.
